author: Alexdiazb
title: A Lego truck for the Lego City transporting Legos...Amazing!
review:
About the 3221 Lego Truck.
I was very surprised when I saw this Lego set in Brickset, as it looks absolutely funny and amazing. When I saw it i really wanted to have it but it wasn't released (or at least I thought it). However, after beein searching here and there, I found that Amazon France was selling it, and even better, having it in stock!. So without any lack of time I just ordered 2 days ago and got it yesterday. Was kinda afraid as there were no image of the truck on the Amazon.fr page, so maybe I was ordering the wrong product. But hopefully everything was perfect.

 

Let's start.
After opening the box, the set come in 3 packages numbered as 1, 2 and 3. Instruction booklet split the building in 3 parts being the 1st the under part of the truck, the figures and the set boxes, the 2nd the "cockpit" of the truck and the 3rd being the "container" of the sets. All in flashy yellow color. (Special mention to the Lego logo stickers, just Amazing!)

 

Building it took me around 2 Hrs 1/2 as I always want to take time and enjoy the pleasure of building, personally I must say it relax me quite a lot.

 

The first part of the building is the under part of the truck, the figures and the small set boxes. Building was easy, and the best part is putting the stickers of the sets on the blue squares. They came by 6 (biggers) representing the firemens, and the truck itself lolol! The 3 smallers would fit better with the police car.

 

The second part was easy to build as well, the cabin comes with a bed, a cup of coffee for the trucker, or tea, or chocolate lol and a nice TV (which is actually the same PC look like square. It was kinda dissapointing but ok). However, at the moment to plug the cabin to the under structure of the truck it doesn't fit properly, I think is related about the plastic or the way the squares allowing the plug of the cabin are disposed. I think it could be better. After 5 minutes dealing to fix it properly, you have to make some pressure between them to make it.

 

Third part was the easiest one as the "container" have big pieces. Also was a pleasure to put the stickers on it. I made a small modification, putting the big side Lego Stickers close to the side doors as it give in my opinion more visibility to the logo and is more aestetically better.

 

After it, try to "play" with it and I realised that the big is kinda big, maybe it could have been better when the container is not to big, so it's easy to turn (if you play with the street plates) and beeing the amount of "Lego sets" included not so much, it could be definitively smaller. 

 

The price was good, as you get something original and makes kinda a tribute to Lego. At the end, I put the sets on the "Toys Dept." of my Grand Emporium set. So people can go and buy Legos in the Lego City. Crazy isn't? ;)

 

Overall conclusion.

A great set to have! Worth the price and it's a nice addition to your Lego City! :D

 

Thanks for reading,

 

Alejandro.

author: matrix_7000
title: A great american style truck!
review:
This set is really great, the yellow color is very flashy and the trailer is very long and has 6 doors.

The truck itself is really cool, it's a new way of building truck.

Very good to play with or to show.

author: starwarsgeek101_
title: Simply Awesome
review:
Intro

I bought this set at Toys R US for $35, which was somewhat of a punch to my budget, but the set is just too likeable to refuse. It comes with 2 minifigures, both of which you would normally see in a City set. The red hat has a slightly different design so that if you put it backwards, it won't cover the eyes. There is also a sticker sheet, of course. Applying the Lego set stickers is probably the most difficult task in the entire build.

The Build

Since the set is a "Moderate Build" it is seperated into numbered bags. Bag 1 contains the minifigures and the base for the driver section of the truck, while bag 2 completes the driver section. This particular section has a nice interior, with a bed and a TV. Bag 3 has all the pieces for the cargo part of the truck. This section doesn't take very long at all to build. The total time to build this set would be approximatly 30-40 minutes.

Conclusion

The set is a bit unstable and the legs that bend forward to stop the truck tend to fall off quite a bit, but the unique interior, along with the details of the driving section of the truck, make this set 4-5 stars.

author: jketron
title: Lego Truck is an excellent addition to your collection
review: I love this truck so much I bought 2. The set goes together easy, the little Lego branded boxes are a great little feature. The directions have you build the two lower sides of the truck where the fuel tank would be slightly different for each side, that didn't make sense so I built them to look the same but a mirror opposite like a real truck. The kit is awesome!!

author: scorpion_156

review:

author: nonameheroes
title: best hauler ever
review: I absolutely have to say that I love this truck. I'm a collector of the city/town theme for Legos and this is a must have for any collector. This is the coolest truck hauler that lego has ever came out with, and the fact that it has mini "lego sets" is cool as well. Overall its a very simple and easy build, took me about 45 minutes. It has a lot of yellow, blue and red elements as those were the original 3 colors of lego, I find it a fitting tribute seeing as its a Lego Hauler. Very much worth every penny I paid for. 35.99 retail at Toys R Us but i had a couple discount coupons so I ended up paying about 25 after tax. Still worth the 35.99 in my opinion.

author: indykid
title: LEGO LEGOs!
review:
I saw this set while ewaiting for my Grand Emporium set to be mailed to my house. So the day after I got my Grand Emporium, I finally went to the store and got it.

Pros:

  • 2 minifigures
  • red cart to push boxes etc

  • bed
  • tv

Cons:

  • stickers instead of printed bricks :P

I love this set and its fun to unload LEGOs at the backdoor of my Grand Emporium and putting the LEGOs in the toy department. I reccommend this set to anyone!

author: Crow5444
title: Best truck made by Lego
review:
It comes with 2 mini-figures, a big storage compartment, Lego boxes, the truck itself, and absolute awesomeness. It moves great and has a bed and TV in the drivers spot. The Lego boxes have a picture of a Fire set, the Police Car set, and the LEGO City Truck set. Update I now have a 2nd one but on this one the truck and trailer to this set now yellow rims on them not grey ones used from the set.

Now here is my pros and cons on it:

Pros:

  • great truck and trailer
  • has lego boxes 9 of them
  • storage compartment fits all boxes with room to spare
  • has a bed and TV
  • two minifigures
  • everything else

Cons:

  • the price is too high and the stickers

author: toofpikk
title: Very much full of fun
review:
story: 

well, I was camping on the isle of Wight, when my mum and my little brother went horse riding. since I am allergic to horses, I could not go so my mum said ill buy you any Lego set under £25. we went to blue water Lego store and brought this...

 Everything!

when I arrived back home i got this out and started building it, and as you would know if you are experienced, time really does fly when you are having fun, I thought I built this in about 5 minutes, turns out it was more like half an hour but I suppose that is because I kept on looking up and getting distracted by my favourite programme from time to time. the set consists of 278 bricks, which seems like a big fat ugly lie when you are building it, for example I thought it was 500! anyway, the set comes in 3 packs of Lego, two for the diesel truck and 1 for the trailer, which is almost surprising because the trailer is about twice the size.

it comes with two relatively good minifigures to go with the set, one with a 'lumberjack' shirt and one with 'dungarees' over a white shirt. inside the trailer is a T.V/data digital board/SAT NAV, a seat, a steering wheel, two doors and two windows and a easily opening roof. on the truck there is two exhaust pipes, six wheels, a detailed front and engine area (under the main area, next to the wheels and stairs) 2 sets of stairs on each side of it and an official Lego sticker here and there.

the trailer has allot more bigger pieces, such as 5X6 wall pieces, big floor tiles and roof tiles.
to put in the trailer there are 9 minuscule Lego sets, a cargo trolley and pole stablers. it has four wheels on a resister, so if is goes over a dump they will move down or up, but it is surprisingly simple. this has a easily detachable roof, and more official stickers

conclusion:

if you know a guy or girl who likes Lego, this is definitely a set for them, with easy play, fun extras and good building and bricks, I certainly suggest this set.

thanks 4 reeding

author: lego_luvu247
title: The best set for any lego luvu!
review:
I have been waiting a long time for lego to make a set that has lego boxes, and a lego set about lego!

author: Firox_5000
title: A lego truck made out of  lego
review:
I bought this from Legoshop.com and all I can say is it's  simply beautifal .

 

The set has three divided builds for the truck and trailer and probably took me 30 minutes to build . When finished the truck looks really nice and is quite long as well .

The interior of the truck is quite nice and has a nice tv in it . While the trailer has plenty of room for lego boxes and is nicely sized . The idea of having lego boxes is quite good , but is a slight shame they chouldn't have printed it on there as they are really hard to put on properly .

 

My only other complaint is that sometimes the trailer supporter falls off and the roof of the truck can break off if you rush to open it .

 

But appart from that it is a simply beautifal set and I think it is good value for it's price .

author: skypirate
title: Excellent LEGO Semi Truck
review:
Overall rating:
This model was pretty irresistible. It's a beautiful and convincing design. LEGO has a lot of large vehicles out lately, all with nice, but very similar grill and headlight assemblies. The 3221 departs from this a little and it's great to have the variety.

The set is also very effective in showcasing LEGO's use of primary colors for branding. Their red logo, current blue packaging and the yellow truck reminding me of older packaging.

Building experience:
Easy, organized build.

Parts:
I don't know the correct name for the parts, but lots of curved, sloped parts. 4 sloped gray grills, 6 tall yellow doors. I seem to be receiving a lot of scuffed windshields lately.

Playability:
Seems to be the perfect truck for a LEGO city. It's ambitious size will either be a blessing or a curse depending upon your needs. One nice touch is the suspension on the trailer wheels, which is loose, ensuring more evenly distruted contact with the road.

When the trailer support is lowered, the trailer doesn't seem level.

One thing that had me puzzled, this is a really large truck for only nine packages. This did lead to comparing it to the 2008 LEGO City Truck & Forklift 7733 for playability and value for money.

Value for money:
This is the one area where I have some unresolved concerns. On a price and part count, the 2008 Truck & Forklift had more pieces at a much lower price. Perhaps inflation or perhaps the 3221 has larger pieces.

LEGO City Truck 3221 (2010), $34.99, 278 pieces
LEGO City Truck & Forklift 7733 (2008), $24.99, 343 pieces

Conclusion:
It's definitely a winner and a classic. Love the design. I consider it close to perfection.

The 2008 Truck & Forklift 7773 with it's adorable forklift and pallets delivers a more complete trucking scenario at a lower price. But I'm glad to have both models.

review:
wow I cannot belive i got this set for my birthday because it is so awesome

author: alva
title: A Lego Truck for your Lego CIty
review:
The first thing that caught my attention to this set is those little blue boxes that act as Lego set boxes. They are really cute. I mean, lego set boxes put in my Lego city? Nice! And if you look at the boxes more closely, you will notice that one of the box set is a box of this set. Cute:P

So I bought one box as soon as the set arrived on local store here. When I built it, the truck was really come out nicely. Love the details they are putting for the truck. This truck even own their own bed and TV set located on the back of the driver's seat, so the driver can sleep and get some entertainment when they drive from city to city. Very nice details. The exterior of the truck is also nice. Really realistic. And the yellow color as the dominant (and the only) color for the truck is very fit and complementing the Lego brands.

I wonder, do Lego really own this kind of truck for delivering their goods?

On the negative side, there are two things that I can think :
1. Stickers : I think Lego is getting too lazy (or too cost conscious?) for making printed parts. All the Lego logos and the box set are done using stickers, not printed. I hate stickers, because they will fell of after some time.
2. Box sets : The amount of those cute blue boxes is too little. I mean, with a truck size this big, but they only give us around 8 boxes?

 Recap :
I love the yellow truck, love the little blue boxes. You must get one for your city, it will be fit in OK, and you can have a Lego truck running around in your Lego city delivering some Lego sets. Very great!

author: Nesquik
title: City Truck is a City Essential
review:
I'll make the opening short; Lego's 3221 'City Truck' is by far and away one of the best City products I've bought since the theme was introduced. I've always been a fan of any branded products because of their cheekiness, and so I was delighted when the Lego Group introduced a new truck.

First off, this truck is definitely inspired by real life American rigs, and is therefore not a completely original design for the Lego city. I read many reviews that stated the main vehicle/cabin was "too sloped" or sluggish, but I think these owners may be forgetting that the Lego group have consistently looked for inspiration from design features all over world - they can't always be european. Despite this, I am actually a fan of the design and feel that it represents an iconic 'truck-look' without being overly pretentious. 

This vehicle has some excellent features, including the lid (see the Lego sticker) that opens and closes on a hinge for easy access to the cabin, the big wing mirrors, the nice spacious interior and a wall mounted computer. Plenty of warning/hazard lights are also located around the vehicle just like in real life. Some have suggested that the cabin should have "two seats, so that other man can sit in too". Again this is poor observation, because the man with the cap is working at the depot and it is his job to move the packages in and out of the trailer with the included red trolley. The driver, on the other hand, is a driver! And a serious coffee drinker by the looks of his mug...

If I'm nit picking, the only two changes I can imagine being made had the product been a higher RRP would be larger wheels and a flip up engine lid.

Another area for debate is the 'pin and disc' method used to connect the trailer to the vehicle. I've had a good look (and play about) with this system and I find it hard to judge where the complaints stem from. The pin slots into the 4x4 flat disc so that, once inserted, it has the ability to move about on an axis in order to provide suspension and shock absorption - particularly when turning tight angles. The only way that the pin part can come away from the trailer is if the user, literally, bends the trailer and forces the part to come away. However, if you simply lift the trailer vertically (as you're supposed to), it comes away without breaking. Call me Mr Obvious, but I think this is just common sense.

We then have the trailer itself, which is itself an empty 'shell' composed of nine large yellow facias and various components holding them in place. Because it is empty, the user may put whatever little packages they like inside the trailer through the various doors on either side and rear end, or through removing the roof section which is intentionally held on a bit looser with a mix of flat and studded plates. Aside from the beautiful Lego decals (stickers, sadly), the best component of this build is the wheel housing. Those genius designers made a lovely mini-build that literally suspends on a single pin and allows the trailer to tilt left, right, back and forth.

In this instance, I would partly agree with other reviewers that the trailer is a little on the more fragile side, but that depends on how rough you play with it. For gliding the truck around, this thing just isn't going to break at all, but I imagine that in hands which are too young, then obviously it will come apart. I personally believe however that the 5-12 age category is pushing it a bit for this model, and would definitely more up to the 8-12 region.

The final delight is the selection of 'packages' that come with the product - nine in total. They are only made from 4x4 bricks with flat plates and stickers, but the stickers themselves have cleverly been designed to replicate not only the packaging for this model, but for other City products too. As I said earlier on, it's a cheeky little world these guys have got! It also provides an incentive to make your own little packages and just fill the trailer full of interesting goods. 

You don't even have to place all the 'Lego' stickers on the vehicle, as you could keep it to a more universal/open delivery truck that could transport all kinds of components. Given the amazing length of this product (39cm!), it would be great for placing long tiles and 1x8 bricks inside for building site.

How happy am I? Over the moon to say the least. I have always been a fan of simpler builds because they represent their counterpart a lot clearly, and I can't imagine any Lego fan or young boy that could resist this lovely big, bright truck. It has minor draw backs, but these are clearly not enough to even put a purchase in question. It will be discontinued soon too!

author: kitsuneblocks
title: Cool Set
review:
I think that this set is a major win for LEGO. It is easy to build, fun to play with, & most importantly, it fits in with the whole new city theme. Although it is to the new scale(6x), you could concievably use this with the older (4x) since it is a tractor trailer.

 

     I was suprised when I assembled this set to find out just how long this bad boy is! It dwarfs anything else city related, dump truck, bus, cargo carrier, etc.

 

     The replay factor is awesome, you can create so many different scenes that utilize this set, a dock, airport, delivery, etc.

     The only downside that I can see with this set is the lack of cargo, you only get 9 small packages and they dont really come close to filling up the trailer, i just wish that there was a couple of large items to complete the cargo!

 

     Overall, the set is a great set to round out your city collection!

author: zipper
title: A well done semit-truck set
review: Even though there isn't a lot of boxes to fill the ginormous trailor with, this set is still a great City set. You only get two minifigs, but the set looks good and is VERY functional. Everything about this set makes you feel like you're reliving the classics from back in the day with a modern twist. Lego made a good set here.

author: TangDynasty
title: Big Bright Yellow Truck!
review:
My son wanted this truck for the longest time. Who can resist a big bright yellow Lego truck? Well, I did resisted buying this for a while as the price was a tad high for my liking. So when there was a sale (about 20% off), I was 'persuaded' to get it.

Box/Instructions

The box is attractive with a big bright yellow Lego truck. A small picture at the bottom front tells you how long the truck is. One thing I noticed at the back of the box is that they did not feature the sleeping area. In my opinion, it would have been better  to feature that rather than showing the inside of the empty container. Maybe, Lego is trying to show potential buyer how big the container is. 

Parts

The usual parts so nothing to shout about here. But, we like the yellow colour. Its a bright and cheerful colour. However, the 'boxes' provided was too few. Only 9 of them. We can of course make more ourselves but it just won't be the same without the stickers. In this aspect, it was a tad disappointing.

Minifigures

2 minifigures here. They are nice additions and the details are pretty nice. We especially like the cap. It's a bit curve at the sides and not like the old one. 

The build

The build is really straight forward. My 7 year old son did it all by himself and he did not find it difficult. So if you are looking for a challenging build, this is not for you. One thing that is 'weak' in this set is the roof of the truck. It is a nice to have the hinges for the roof  so that we can just open up the top of the truck. Unfortunately, it comes off very often. It can get frustrating as we have to keep fixing it back. 

The completed model

The completed model is nice. It's our first City set so I must say we are happy with it. We like the colour (Yes, I have repeated it several times, just can't help but liking the yellow colour) and the overall feel to it. The playability is good except for insufficient boxes and the roof of the truck. 

Summary

I think the set is a nice addition to our Lego collection. The colour and overall look is good. The completed model is certainly attractive. The price is OK only after discount. I have given a rating of 4 based on the discounted price. It is a tough call but I wouldn't recommend it at the full retail price. However, if there is a substantial discount for the set, you can consider getting it.

Thanks for reading and I hope you find the review useful.

author: Muffinman4
title: Amazing!
review:
First of all I want to know who told Lego to be more detailed.  A couple of years ago they wouldn't have put all of this detail in their sets.

Pros:

  • New red hat
  • Two pieces
  • Huge trailer
  • TV and Bed

Cons:

  • Top on cab comes off easily

Overall an AMAZING set.

If you are contemplating between this set and another set:  GET THIS ONE!! 
  •

author: AETerry
title: LEGO City Truck Review
review:
This set along with the 7848 Toys R Us Truck set are very similiar where the build and construction of vehicles are concerned. The difference of course is the color of bricks used, this truck using yellow and LEGO's own logo and minibuilds for boxes with a delivery truck delivering product within a Lego City or Town.

 

Like 7848, I also did a slight modification of the build on the truck so it would be symetrical in appearance instead of lop sided. In the picture you can see the grey cylindrical piece, it's that part of the step that's modified so the piece on the opposite side is in the same spot.

 

There are two minifigures, the truck driver, who looks exactly like the Toys R Us truck driver and a guy wearing overalls with a redcap who's pushing a dolley around for loading and unloading the boxes of lego sets on/off the truck.

 

If you've already bought the Toys R Us Truck set or you buy it after having picked up this set up first, you'll see that repetitiveness in build. I figure that's alright given how solid a build these trucks have and it's fun to see some "real-world" products and logos in a Lego City/Town, adding a sense of realism to it. Which can be fun provided it's not obvious or forced or the price of a set goes up as a result.

author: clundsberg
title: Rollin' Down The Highway Lego-Style
review:
This is an extremely excellent set.  My son just received this today on his 6th b-day and it's currently holding it's own against a newly acquired Nintendo DS.

It's just that good.

When we first saw this item at the store, my son broke out into hysterical laughter at what he considered a nice little joke:  "A Lego Truck that is selling Legos and LOOK it has pictures of some of my Lego sets on the boxes!"

Right then and there I knew what he was getting for his Birthday.

The actual build is pretty neat.  Not as boring or repetitious as most symmetrical vehicles seem to be.  It was almost more a a center to outward build...a very sturdy cab.  It has a very spacious trailer that can store the boxes, the red truck/cart that is included and tons more of whatever cargo needs a-transportin.  When separated from the cab, the trailer has a hinge-stand to maintain stability.  The trailer's wheels are a neat little build in and of themself that reminded me of Optimus Prime's "Roller" vehicle. (cudos to anyone who manages to convert this semi into Optimus Prime by the way)

The cab portion is extremely detailed:  The flip-up canopy for driver access (while it breaks off every once in a while) is a beautiful touch.  Inside there is a seat for a driver, a bed, dashboard for coffee mug, and television.  Normally I'm disappointed that Lego vehicles do not make room for 2 seats, however since there is a bed in there, that's plenty of room for a secondary figure.  Outward appearances like 2 sets of side windows and, side gas tanks and clear over orange fornt light/brake and turn signals and roof lights are a plus.

This is a nice long semi which makes for an authentic feel.  Lots of stickers (many people on here seem to complain about stickers, but they...) add to the detail of this rig and it's contents.

This is a quasi-expensive set around the $35-40 mark, but I also think this is one of those sleeper sets that is pure gold (or...er...yellow) and collectors may regret not purchasing it while it's easily available.

author: Doctor_Leg_O_Brick
title: amazing just amazing......
review:
This must come up in most fans of city top ten's. Well, it does for me!! I got this as a gift from my grandad, and well, when ever look at it make me smile. The detail is just shocking, the mini-figures are unbeatable and the price for each brick is as good as the set. Also i will add some think new to my reviews.....

 

 

THE BOX

Its nice, good sample of the many things you can do with it and as with some bigger sets it shows you how long it is. I would also like to say that if you live in the U.S.A you get the name, pieces and some other things ware as in the UK we just get the age and number.

 

THE BUILD

Very good, griping, keeps you building. I like that the more newer sets have numbered bags, so to thoose who are not bright sparks at building a 1000 plus set in a big mess. It takes about 10/20/30 minutes, but as allways it depends.

 

THE PLAYABILITY

Very, very good. The amount of things one can do with a lego truck!! Supermarkets, airports, toy makers, toy shops, the list go's on what you can add to it. The lego box's add a lot more playability along with the worker. I mean, how can you go wrong with a lego truck??

 

THE PARTS

A great use of old classic's. Some of the parts, mostly in the cab, are rarely made, making this even more of a gem. One more part is the cab's door, witch made its come back about 2 years ago. Great if you need a truck in a MOC.

 

THE MONEY

In the UK, it was £30, but i got it for £20. £30 is to much but on the sale price its what lego shold be.

 

THE OVERALL RATING

Five bricks out of five bricks, how can you rate it at 4??

author: sf1378
title: GRRR-REAT!
review:
Great set. Its like a modern update of the original Legoland yellow truck and trailer from the 1980s. 

Bought it for £19.95 at John Lewis, a much better price point overall for a Lego set, even at this size. In places like The Entertainer its £24.00! 

Pros: Really liked the numbered bag system to make specific parts before merging it all together.

Love the playability factor and TWO figures, I imagine on a long haul one can have a sleep while the other drives, speaking of which, theres a bed, t.v., MUG (bless!) in the cab.

I also liked the build, the use of different coloured parts on the chassis helps make building smoother rather than misinterpreting the positioning of certain parts, especially flat plates.

CONS:

Stickers rather than printed parts...why Lego? WHY?! lol...but even so....

Trailer attachment is a bit weak and should have been compatible with other trucks in the new 6x City based scale...

Not enough cargo for such a long 39 cm trailer unit. 

I'd like to get the TOYS 'R' US exclusive set variant of this too at some stage.

author: nivracer
title: lego is truck'n
review:
• I got this set at the lego store in the mall in Austin TX for $34.99, the price was a little high but I got it any way because it had lego stckers on it. Now for pros and cons

      pros for truck:

  • it does not have a flat front (yay!)
  • roof opens up to put minifigs in easier
  • realistic smok stack
  • mug
  • TV
  • bed
  • doors
  • widos in the back
  • 6 wheels instead of 4

      cons for truck:

  • the roof that opens up falls of every 2-3 times I open it
  •  there was no signals in the back so I added a white 1 by 6 and put the licence plate, red brake lights, and I added orange signals

      pros for minifigs:

  • they both have new faces I have never seen
  • the one with the hat has a new shirt/torso

      cons for minifigs:

  • none!

      pros for tralier:

  • troley
  • 9 boxes
  • 4 lego stickers
  • mud flaps

      cons for tralier:

  • the small boxes are hard to get off the studs
  • could have came with more boxes
  • don't know what the clear bricks are for in the top, front of the tralier, I changed thoes with yellow 1 by 1 slope brick

so get this set before the kids in your lego city get bored.

author: av8r1973
title: Conventional tractor-trailer - finally!
review:
This is a nice attempt at an American-style tractor trailer.  The cab looks to be a Volvo-type with a full sleeper (complete with bed and TV).  The driver kicks back with his coffee cup and lets the miles go by.

The trailer is nicely proportioned and was simple to build.  A pair of doors on both sides, as well as one on the end.  The packages in the truck are mini brick-built LEGO sets that have pictures of some of the 2010 models that we have.  That was clever.  Of course, the blatant advertising for LEGO all over it doesn't go unnoticed, but we bought it anyway.

There are a few negatives that really brought the rating down for me.  First, the front bumper of the truck falls off if you look at it wrong.  Just not enough grip on the four studs that hold all the weight up.  

The top of the cab opens up really nicely to get the great minifigs in and out (they can use the doors, too, but my hands are too big).  Unfortunately, the hinge snaps off of the truck when either opening or closing the top.

The trailer axles are on some sort of pivot.  I thought I built it incorrectly because the wheels fall off if I pick the trailer up.  I see now that it was intentional and allows the tandem axles to "float" over small obstacles.  This just means you can't pick the trailer up.

The feet that hold the trailer end up when the tractor drives away can't be placed vertically due to the part used.  It is close, but will collapse if even a little weight is put on the trailer.

No unique parts were used (aside from a single-piece handtruck, so I was a little disappointed.  For US$30, I would like to have seen a bit more value.  After all, the trailer only has a few pieces.

On the positive side, the minifigs are nice.  One with a plaid shirt (presumably the driver) and another to load the truck. The bold yellow color looks great in a City diorama.  Having a conventional cab is nice, since the rest of my City collection are Euro-style cabover trucks.

Not a must have, and I wouldn't have purchased it if it weren't on sale.  This is a $19.99 kit, at best.  The cons drive this down to the lowest rating I have given a kit.  Sorry, LEGO.

author: Steamrunner
title: Not bad, but a few bugs
review:
As someone who has only recently become reacquainted with Lego, I picked this up as I saw it going cheap in my local Tesco (less than a tenner). For that price, and really only intended as a parts purchase, I thought there was no harm in throwing it in the basket with the groceries.

Up until this set I'd been busy with the Mindstorms set I got from my wife for Christmas, although I had also bought the 8043 Excavator which was yet to be tackled, so this is my first "proper" Lego set for about 25 years or so. I hadn't really looked at the pictures on the box, so when I finished building it I was quite surprised at the amount of detail in the model. The front bumper is shaped, there are lights all over, there's a bed in the cab (and a TV), and generally lots of little details that show that a lot of thought has been put into this model.

Which is why it's so surprising that there are still a few bugs (for want of a better term). For example, where the cab sides meet the back of the cab there are gaps (due to the pieces used to form the sides). This is very odd and really stands out on an otherwise flawless design. The trailer sides are held together by a few short studded pieces along the top, with longer smooth pieces in between - I really cannot understand why this is (they're not used for a second model as there are only instructions for this one) as because they are different pieces, you can see the difference from the side of the trailer. It's a small thing, but I just don't understand why they'd use smooth pieces instead of studded ones all round. Very odd. The final design flaw is that the lift-up roof - which is a lovely touch, don't get me wrong - tends to pop off if you raise it (or indeed lower it) as the hinge piece isn't held in place. Since I don't "play" with the models as such (except for showing my wife, who was also quite surprised at how much Lego has changed since we were kids) it doesn't really bother me as I won't be opening it, but I can see it getting annoying for kids who do want to play at putting the figures in the cab. One final thought, and this is a good thing, is that it's nice to have the choice if whether you have whopping great Lego logos on the pieces. I haven't used the stickers, so the pieces won't look odd if I use them elsewhere.

Anyway, although I think the kit is slightly overpriced at full RRP, it's a lovely model and really quite impressive to see what can be done with a small amount of bricks and a lot of attention to detail. I'm impressed - and if the roof didn't keep coming off when moved, I'd even go so far as to say really impressed.

author: Bram
title: An "American Lego Truck" & building tips
review:
I just got this baby a while back in Amsterdam during a short trip. This is one of the most notable big truck sets that came in 2010, other than the 3180 Tank Truck and the TRU's version. I always prefer the Lego version instead of the TRU one. The yellow color really emphasizes the size of this truck.

Notable plus points:
- Finally a true "American" long nose six wide trucks, a fresh change from the usual Euro cabovers. Represent the current modern Freightliner or Volvo VN series tractor.
- A true interstate long distance semi tractor with loads of amenities, including a bed for some "brick-backseat luvin" LOL.
- Clever use of rear trailer 'suspension' with a degree of tilting to adapt road surfaces
- Most beautiful truck design in an official set with that clean aerodynamic lines.
- "Grows" in size once assembled. Thanks to that long '48-footer' at the back. A lot longer than "39" cm suggest on the box.
-Yellow. What's better than a big yellow truck is an even bigger yellow truck!

Building tips for AFOLs (and kids too):
If you're an AFOL (like me) this might matter to you. On instruction p.17, is the assembly instruction for the side fuel tank and sideskirts. If you look, the instruction says to build 2 similar sub assemblies. Well that's wrong! If you do so then you will have misligned fuel filler caps left and right when the truck is viewed from above. Just look at p.19. The three rows of Modified 1 x 2 x 1 1/3  Curved brick is in diagonal position left to right. What you need is to reposition them so they're parallel left to right. Easy fix!

Tips for kids, and 'childish AFOLs'
A dab of silicone oil (Mom's cooking oil will work too kids!) on the wheel holder axles before attaching the wheels will eliminate plastic to plastic squeeks when the truck is rolling. And makes then truck rolls smoother and further too :) Don't play on the tables!

Verdict
If you' into automotive designs and heavy transportations in general (like me!), this set is for you..if you're an American car fan, this set IS for you. If you're a Classic Town fan, this thing will seize up the traffic, too big. If you don't like Lego...well what the heck are you doing reading this? Go play with your Playmobil! Hahaha..JK.

Thanks for reading guys.

author: BrickTVReviews
title: Cruisin The Highways LEGO Style!
review:
Welcome back to BrickTVReviews with set 3221 LEGO City Truck ages 5-12 $34.99, 2 minifigures and 278 pieces. Pro cons review.

Pros

-Truck has TV and bed inside driver's cab

-LEGO sets in a lego set. Reincarnations of 7236 Police Car, 7245 Off Road Fire Rescue and the set itself.

-Unique hood design.

Cons

-The driver's cab often separates from it's base.

-The bumper has so many pieces and there is only 4 studs to hold them in place.

 

                                 Anyway this is a great set! The fifth LEGO Truck produced. Get this when it is still around! Goodbye and have a nice day.

author: Mr__Minifigure
title: Great truck from LEGO...
review:
This truck is an excellent buy, and I would recommend it to older fans of LEGO. It's a great addition to anyone's collection. 


Upside:

First of all, it is solidly built and generally does not fall apart easily. Secondly, it is large in size, which doesn't hurt. Third, it is an American style truck, which is relatively rare from LEGO, as most trucks are Euro-styled. Also, the inclusion of LEGO boxes is cool as well. And, it looks absolutely great in a city because it's so bright and large (just make sure your figs know it takes wide right turns). 


Build Difficulty:

It is a simple build, like most City vehicles. It has a slightly more involved build than some sets, but it would be a piece of cake for anyone over the age of 7 with any LEGO building experience. 


Downside:

There are a few things I would change about it, though: First of all, the fact that there are so few LEGO boxes is disappointing. Second, the rear axles of the trailer that allow it to have its own "suspension" fall apart easily, and are a pain to reassemble, making it not an optimal set for younger kids. Finally, it is very expensive, in my opinion, for $35 USD. It's a very good set, but that's a bit much in my opinion. 

Conclusion:

I would recommend this to older LEGO fans, so long as they can get past the high purchase price. It's a great addition to any vehicle fleet.

author: Harm1
title: Lego built out of lego
review:
Positive:
- Lego sets built out of lego. Need I say more?
- It's big and it's yellow.
- The set has a very nice timeless look to it.
- It has some nice yellow parts, including some that are unique to this set.
- The build is pretty nice, and the suspension at the back of the truck is a nice addition.

Negative:
- Stickers. Apart from the fact that stickers just don't belong in a lego set, in a set with this many stickers and at this price at least a few of them should have been printed pieces.
- The recommended retail price is very high. Luckily the set is normally sold at a much lower price.

Conclusion: The truck itself is decent. It's the lego sets and fact that it's a lego truck that make this set much better then average.

author: redbeardlegoman
title: Oh so meta!
review:
As soon as I saw the Lego City Truck, I knew I had to have it.  My wife figured it out, too.  And kept talking me out of buying it, citing budget and whatnot, until she could sneak it on me for Christmas.  She's awesome.

I love the look of this big yellow truck, hauling my favourite toy into the streets of my Lego city.  I wonder at the concept of Lego toys within Lego toys.  One of those little sets is a tiny Lego City Truck, presumably complete with its own micro Lego City Truck, and its nano Lego City Truck, ad infinitum.  That pleases me in a warm spot inside.

I think the cab of the truck looks really good.  It fits in with the aesthetic of Lego City, and still looks very much like a real transport truck.  I love the details in the sleeper cab, such as the television.

The landing gear on the trailer work well, and add another convincing detail to the entire set.

There are two areas in which I can hope for something better.  The first is the opening top of the cab.  Due to the locking hinge, it is difficult to open the top without popping it off.  If I have to remove it to access the inside anyway, why bother putting it on a hinge?  Could we not use the older style, analogue hinge?  I know the piece would have to be redesigned, but...

The other concern I have is that it is somewhat difficult to put the little Lego sets in the trailer.  You can only get a couple in by the doors, and it is hard to get my ham-sized gorilla fists into the trailer through the roof panels.  Maybe another couple of sets of doors along the sides would have helped?

I guess a very minor third issue I have is the gas tanks along the bottom of the cab.  The tank itself is asymmetrical, with a round 1x1 brick in the sixth position along from the bottom left in the instructions.  By simply making two exact copies, you miss out on the much more aesthetically pleasing handedness of having the two 1x1s on the exact opposite sides of one another.  Again, however, this is a minor thing, which I just fix on my own.  I also build all my vehicles as right-hand drive, for my own reasons.  

I've read that others are not so in love with the pin-and-plate hitch.  I've found no problem with it, and it has been given a good long drive around my Lego city.  While I do agree that the suspension on the trailer is a bit flimsy, it hasn't caused me any great worry or problem.  As well, I have no problems with stickers.  I do prefer printed pieces, but I can live with stickers.  The benefit to stickers is that I can use the intended piece as something else, without having to worry about printing, especially if the piece is rare in a certain colours.

Pros

  • It's just so meta, and I love that.
  • It looks good, and it looks like what it is.
  • Yellow is just such a happy colour!
  • The sleeper cab is well-designed and detailed.
  • The landing gear are appropriate and functional.

Cons

  • The top of the sleeper cab comes off much more easily than it opens.
  • It's hard to get all your little Lego sets into the trailer, especially if you have hands like phone books and fingers like sausages.
  • The gas tanks are not handed in their symmetry (1/2 con).

Unless stickers really, really bother you, how can you not love this happy yellow truck full of delicious Lego goodness?

author: brickparidise
title: the lovely yellow truck
review:
I got this set two years ago for my birthday and I love it because of

1. it is based on a Volvo truck (which is really cool)

2.it has 2 minifigs a truck driver (which is what my dad does) and a co driver (maybe his brother?)

3. it has a sleeping area with a TV (maybe if he has to work long hours)

but there is things I would like to make it better

1. a fridge and a microwave in the cabin (they can just be stickers)

2. if it had more Lego sets (like a couple of fire station sets) 

3. a fire extinguisher  (hello for if there is a fire)

that's all I have to say thank you for reading.

author: Brickdarg
title: I love that this exists
review: This is one of the coolest sets city has ever made, which is admittedly not a high bar, but this is still an excellent set. The stickered lego sets are an excellent detail and help to fill out the inside of the truck, which unfortunately is left a bit barren, but there's still more than enough to fill it out decently. I don't normally like yellow vehicles, but I'll make an exception here because this thing looks incredible. The large lego logo stickers also add a lot to this set's amazing looks, and the truck is surprisingly modern in its build. The figures are a little lacking, which is one of only a few nitpicks I have with the set. With that said, this is still an abosulte classic of a lego city set, and I highly recommend it to any lego fan in general.

author: mr_Fikou
title: Oldie but a goldie.
review:
This set has been with me since my youth, I remember getting it for my birthday once and it has remained in assembled state ever since. Now, nearly 12 years later, I decided it's time to put it in the spotlights once again.


Parts

I wouldn't say this is a great parts pack, but it's not awful. There's a nice amount of plates and yellow panels that build up the trailer, and the cabin has a few useful slopes and brackets. The sticker sheet has LEGO logos in various sizes, but those have become more and more common in recent years. In the end you're still better off passing on this if you don't care about the build.

 

Build process

I greatly value the building process, and sadly this set did not excite me that much with its building techniques or part usage. The connection of the rearmost wheels to the trailer is mildly interesting, but that's about it.

Unfortunately, the construction of the trailer's cargo area is pretty poor. Before connecting the roof plates, the entire build is incredibly fragile and is easily broken if everything's not perfectly aligned when adding new parts. Fortunately, once the roof is added the build is fully solid and you needn't bother about accidentally breaking it anymore. Because the trailer is a quick build using a lot of large parts, this luckily isn't very bothering in the grand scheme of things.

On a sidenote, rebuilding the set did bring me back to the good 'ol days of City trucks and cars with its wonderfully nostalgic and straight-forward yet effective design.

 

Features

Aside the obvious features like having spinning wheels and the like, here are some things that I thought to be noteworthy:

- there's a lot of space inside the cabin which has been used to house a driver's area, a bed/couch and a tv. It's slightly tricky to get both figures in comfortably, but it can be done without any major hiccups.

- the trailer hitch is pretty loose, however it won't come off by just riding or displaying it. It also makes attaching and detaching super easy. Just don't expect it to come along if you only hold the cabin while picking it up.

- there's a dead-simple folding mechanism for the trailer's landing gear, but it works very well!

- accessing the spacious interior of the trailer is harder and a bit more frustrating than it should be. There's a couple small doors that work alright, but the small amount of tiny LEGO boxes rattle around easily and will only come out by tilting the trailer until they drop. You can detach the roof plates, but they're firmly connected and if not done carefully you're at risk of breaking off some wall panels as well.

- included is, of course, a pile of minifig-sized LEGO-boxes! There's nine in total, one of which depicts this very set. It's very meta and I thought it was hilarious as a kid. However, compared to the cargo space this is a very minimal amount. I'd love to fill up the truck more, perhaps even with some pallets. Well, that's what Bricklink is for! :)

 

Appearance

Well, what can I say? It's a big, yellow truck, with an American-styled cabin shape and LEGO logos all over it. But, it's one of the very few depictions LEGO has made of their delivery vehicles and, in my opinion, by far the cleanest-looking one. Additionally, this subject has only been represented once after this set, being the delivery van that came as part of set #60097 Town Square in 2015.

Even though this set is 5 years older than #60097 and is currently approaching its 12th birthday, the aged design doesn't look out of place next to the current lineup of City vehicles. So, all in all, if a LEGO-LEGO delivery truck is what you want, #3221 is still your safest bet!

 

Verdict

LEGO City Truck is a wonderful example of the timeless nature of LEGO products. Even after a decade, LEGO hasn't remade the subject yet; I like to think it's because with how well #3221 holds up, there's simply no need for an update. The minor flaws don't detract from all the great things that the set has to offer, and I feel that this overall is one of the most successful and memorable LEGO City products in history.
